summary:
=== Purchase Information === Product Title: Tammy and the Bachelor / Tammy Tell Me True / Tammy and the Doctor (Triple Feature) Review Date: 2013/01/14 Store: Debbie Reynolds (Actor), Walter Brennan (Actor), Harry Keller (Director), Joseph Pevney (Director) & 1 more Rated: NR Format: DVD Categories: Movies & TV, Boxed Sets, Classics Product Description: ['Tammy and the Bachelor: Academy Award nominee Debbie Reynolds stars in this romantic comedy, the first feature in the delightful Tammy series. Meet young Tammy, a homespun Mississippi gal who, in the course of her first extraordinary adventure, teaches a sophisticated bachelor (Leslie Nielsen) about love, an uptight Southern town about fun, and a modern family about happiness. Tammy Tell Me True: The adventures of Tammy continue in college, where the worldly-wise small-town gal helps a broken-hearted artist paint a happy future, teaches a haughty heiress that the Golden Rule is more precious than gold, and finds true love with a shy, handsome young professor. Golden Globe winner Sandra Dee proves that Tammy is more than just another fish out of water in this charming and touching comedy. Tammy and the Doctor: Sandra Dee returns as the irrepressible Tammy in the enchanting third feature. It’s fun at a fever pitch as Tammy turns “nurse” in Los Angeles, hilariously turning a hospital upside down, treating patients with homemade brews and potions and, of course, falling in mad love with a handsome young surgeon (Peter Fonda).Bonus Content:', 'Disc 1 - Tammy and the Bachelor:', 'Tammy and the Bachelor Trailer', 'Tammy and the Bachelor Trailer', 'Disc 2 - Tammy and the Doctor:', 'Tammy and the Doctor Trailer', 'Tammy and the Doctor Trailer'] Average Rating: 4.8 Product Details: {'Genre': 'Comedy', 'Format': 'Multiple Formats, Box set, NTSC, Widescreen, Color', 'Contributor': 'Fay Wray, Mildred Natwick, Oscar Brodney, Leslie Nielsen, April Kent, Cid Ricketts Sumner, Mala Powers, Joseph Pevney, Craig Hill, Philip Ober, Debbie Reynolds, Sidney Blackmer, Ralph Brooks, Walter Brennan, Harry Keller, Louise BeaversFay Wray, Mildred Natwick, Oscar Brodney, Leslie Nielsen, April Kent, Cid Ricketts Sumner, Mala Powers, Joseph Pevney, Craig Hill, Philip Ober, Debbie Reynolds, Sidney Blackmer, Ralph Brooks, Walter Brennan, Harry Keller, Louise Beavers See more', 'Initial release date': '2008-02-05', 'Language': 'Unqualified, English (Dolby Digital 2.0 Mono)', 'Aspect Ratio': '2.35:1, 1.85:1', 'Is Discontinued By Manufacturer': 'No', 'MPAA rating': 'NR (Not Rated)', 'Product Dimensions': '0.56 x 5.36 x 7.49 inches; 2.88 Ounces', 'Item model number': '1103098', 'Director': 'Harry Keller, Joseph Pevney', 'Media Format': 'Multiple Formats, Box set, NTSC, Widescreen, Color', 'Run time': '4 hours and 34 minutes', 'Release date': 'February 5, 2008', 'Actors': 'Debbie Reynolds, Walter Brennan, Leslie Nielsen, Mala Powers, Sidney Blackmer', 'Subtitles': 'French, Spanish', 'Studio': 'Studio Distribution Services', 'Writers': 'Cid Ricketts Sumner, Oscar Brodney', 'Country of Origin': 'USA', 'Number of discs': '2'} Review Text: The Product was exactly as I expected and it arrived quickly. Arrived without damage of any kind. Would order again. Review Title: Love the movies! Rating: 4.0 -------------------------------------------------- === Purchase Information === Product Title: Rear Window [DVD] Review Date: 2013/03/30 Store: James Stewart (Actor), Grace Kelly (Actor), Alfred Hitchcock (Director, Producer) & 0 more Rated: PG Format: DVD Categories: Movies & TV, Genre for Featured Categories, Drama Product Description: ['Directed by the Master of Suspense, Alfred Hitchcock\'s Rear Window is an edge-of-your-seat classic starring two of Hollywood\'s most popular stars. When a professional photographer (James Stewart) is confined to a wheelchair with a broken leg, he becomes obsessed with watching the private dramas of his neighbors play out across the courtyard. When he suspects his neighbor of murdering his nagging wife, he enlists his socialite girlfriend (Grace Kelly) to help investigate the suspicious chain of events, leading to one of the most memorable and gripping endings in all of film history. Honored in AFI\'s 100 Years…100 Movies for excellence in film, Rear Window has also been hailed as "one of Alfred Hitchcock\'s most stylish thrillers" (Leonard Maltin\'s Classic Movie Guide).', 'Bonus Content:', 'Rear Window Ethics: An Original Documentary', 'Rear Window Ethics: An Original Documentary', 'A Conversation with Screenwriter John Michael Hayes', 'A Conversation with Screenwriter John Michael Hayes', 'Production Photographs', 'Production Photographs', 'Production Notes', 'Production Notes', 'Re-Release Trailer Narrated by James Stewart', 'Re-Release Trailer Narrated by James Stewart', 'Theatrical Trailer', 'Theatrical Trailer', ']]>'] Average Rating: 4.8 Product Details: {'Genre': 'Rent movie, Mystery movie, Alfred Hitchcock movie, DVD movie, Blu-ray movie, Oscar movie, Movie night, Drama, Best Director movie, Academy Award movie, 4K movie, Thriller movie, Mystery & Suspense/Thrillers, Buy movie, Suspense movie, Digital movie, Drama movie, Jimmy Stewart movie, Mystery & SuspenseRent movie, Mystery movie, Alfred Hitchcock movie, DVD movie, Blu-ray movie, Oscar movie, Movie night, Drama, Best Director movie, Academy Award movie, 4K movie, Thriller movie, Mystery & Suspense/Thrillers, Buy movie, Suspense movie, Digital movie, Drama movie, J… See more', 'Format': 'Multiple Formats, Color, Dubbed, NTSC, Subtitled, Widescreen', 'Contributor': 'Grace Kelly, Thelma Ritter, Alfred Hitchcock, Robert Burks, John Michael Hayes, Wendell Corey, Loren L. Ryder, James Stewart, Raymond BurrGrace Kelly, Thelma Ritter, Alfred Hitchcock, Robert Burks, John Michael Hayes, Wendell Corey, Loren L. Ryder, James Stewart, Raymond Burr See more', 'Initial release date': '2012-09-04', 'Language': 'English (Dolby Digital 2.0), French (Dolby Digital 2.0)', 'Aspect Ratio': '1.66:1', 'Is Discontinued By Manufacturer': 'No', 'MPAA rating': 'PG (Parental Guidance Suggested)', 'Product Dimensions': '0.7 x 7.5 x 5.4 inches; 2.56 Ounces', 'Item model number': '1123521', 'Director': 'Alfred Hitchcock', 'Media Format': 'Multiple Formats, Color, Dubbed, NTSC, Subtitled, Widescreen', 'Run time': '1 hour and 55 minutes', 'Release date': 'September 4, 2012', 'Actors': 'James Stewart, Grace Kelly, Raymond Burr, Wendell Corey, Thelma Ritter', 'Dubbed': 'French', 'Subtitles': 'Spanish', 'Producers': 'Alfred Hitchcock', 'Studio': 'Universal Pictures Home Entertainment', 'Writers': 'John Michael Hayes', 'Number of discs': '1'} Review Text: This is one of my favorite Jimmy Stewart movies. I like the idea of watching all the different lives unfold and the suspense. I like suspenseful movies not gory horror movies. Review Title: One of mt favorite movies Rating: 5.0 -------------------------------------------------- === Purchase Information === Review Date: 2013/06/30 Average Rating: 4.7 Product Details: {'Content advisory': ['Violence', 'alcohol use', 'foul language', 'sexual content'], 'Audio languages': ['English', 'English [Audio Description]'], 'Subtitles': ['English [CC]'], 'Directors': ['Michael Smith', 'Anton Cropper', 'Christopher Misiano', 'Kevin Bray', 'Roger Kumble', 'Silver Tree', 'John Scott', 'Cherie Nowlan', 'Gabriel Macht', 'Patrick J. Adams'], 'Producers': ['David Bartis', 'Gene Klein', 'Aaron Korsh', 'Doug Liman', 'Nathan Perkins', 'Daniel Arkin', 'Rick Muirragui', 'Jonathan Hackett', 'Patrick J. Adams', 'Gabriel Macht', 'Genevieve Sparling', 'Ethan Drogin', 'Jon Cowan', 'Anton Cropper', 'Lilla Zuckerman', 'Nora Zuckerman', 'Gavin Barclay', 'Kevin Bray', 'Silver Tree', 'Desmond Paes', 'Chris Downey', 'Ryan Kennedy', 'Paul Redford', 'Sean Jablonski', 'Steve Wakefield', 'Mark Winemaker', 'Chevy Chen', 'Igor Srubshchik', 'Kyle Long', 'Natalie Urquhart', 'Jonathan Starch'], 'Starring': ['Gabriel Macht', 'Patrick J. Adams', 'Rick Hoffman'], 'Studio': ['USA']} Review Text: I chose my tv viewing carefully and I thought this show was clever and entertaining through season 1. My only complaint would be there was too much unnecessary language but was willing to lower my standards for some entertainment that did not focus on the sexual relationships of the characters. What planet do these people live in that in a professional setting they swear in every sentence. Considering that they portray educated people, surely they use more articulate language to express their feelings.

Season 2 however was just too much. Too much drama, too much personal angst and definitely too visually inappropriate in the last episode. I never want to watch other people have sex and if this is the direction the show continues to take, this is the end of me watching this series. Review Title: Sad at the turn of events Rating: 2.0 -------------------------------------------------- === Purchase Information === Review Date: 2013/07/30 Average Rating: 4.8 Product Details: {'Audio languages': ['English'], 'Subtitles': ['English [CC]'], 'Directors': ['Graeme Harper', 'Euros Lyn', 'Jamie Magnus Stone', 'Douglas Mackinnon', 'Rachel Talalay', 'James Strong', 'Charlie Palmer', 'James Hawes', 'Joe Ahearne', 'Toby Haynes'], 'Starring': ['Christopher Eccleston', 'Billie Piper'], 'Studio': ['BBC America']} Review Text: I tend to like shows that are a little on the odd side and with characters that are unusual so this show fit the bill. I'm into season 3 and still enjoy suspending reality for a while and toodling across the universe with the good Doctor. Review Title: Quirky which is why I like it Rating: 4.0 -------------------------------------------------- === Purchase Information === Product Title: An American Tail Review Date: 2015/01/12 Store: Dom DeLuise (Actor), Christopher Plummer (Actor), Don Bluth (Director, Producer) & 0 more Rated: G Format: DVD Categories: Movies & TV, Fully Loaded DVDs, DTS Product Description: ["From director Don Bluth and creator David Kirschner, this critically acclaimed full-length animated triumph chronicles the wide-eyed adventures of a courageous little mouse named Fievel. Journeying by ship from Russia to turn-of-the-century America, Fievel is lost at sea during a ferocious storm. Washing ashore in New York Harbor, Fievel braves the perils and wonders of a strange new world in a thrilling quest to find his family. Featuring the voices of Dom DeLuise, Madeline Kahn and Christopher Plummer, it's a rousing, heartwarming animated adventure for the entire family!Bonus Content:", 'How Do I Find Things?', 'How Do I Find Things?', "Fievel and Tiger's Duo Dance Game", "Fievel and Tiger's Duo Dance Game", 'Counting with Digit Game', 'Counting with Digit Game', 'Rewease the Secwet Weapon Game', 'Rewease the Secwet Weapon Game', '"Somewhere Out There" Sing-Along Song', '"Somewhere Out There" Sing-Along Song', 'Theatrical Trailer', 'Theatrical Trailer'] Average Rating: 4.8 Product Details: {'Aspect Ratio': '1.33:1', 'Is Discontinued By Manufacturer': 'No', 'MPAA rating': 'G (General Audience)', 'Product Dimensions': '5.31 x 7.52 x 0.63 inches; 2.54 Ounces', 'Item model number': '2288053', 'Director': 'Don Bluth', 'Media Format': 'Multiple Formats, AC-3, Color, Dolby, Full Screen, NTSC, Subtitled, Dubbed, DTS Surround Sound', 'Run time': '1 hour and 21 minutes', 'Release date': 'January 20, 2004', 'Actors': 'Dom DeLuise, Christopher Plummer, Madeline Kahn, John Finnegan, Phillip Glasser', 'Dubbed': 'French, Spanish', 'Subtitles': 'French, Spanish', 'Producers': 'Don Bluth, John Pomeroy, Gary Goldman, Steven Spielberg', 'Language': 'English (Dolby Digital 5.1), Spanish (Dolby Digital 5.1), English (DTS 5.1), French (Dolby Digital 2.0 Stereo)', 'Studio': 'Studio Distribution Services', 'Writers': 'Tony Geiss, Judy Freudberg', 'Number of discs': '1'} Review Text: Replaced our VHS and was as good as any other DVD we've ordered. Grand kids liked the movie (ages 8-2) Review Title: Replaced our VHS and was as good as any other DVD we've ordered Rating: 5.0 -------------------------------------------------- === Purchase Information === Review Date: 2015/01/12 Average Rating: 4.4 Product Details: {'Subtitles': ['None available'], 'Directors': ['Lionsgate'], 'Starring': ['Bob Harper'], 'Studio': ['Lionsgate']} Review Text: Enjoyed this. Beginner yoga. Did it with hubby who has never done yoga before but likes Bob so I figured if there was ever a chance that he was going to try yoga, this would be it. He did the whole tape and sweat. No longer says yoga is easy girl exercise. It moves faster than I care for as I like yoga for relaxation and stretching but it makes you work through basic poses. Review Title: Enjoyed this. When a professional photographer (James Stewart) is confined to a wheelchair with a broken leg, he becomes obsessed with watching the private dramas of his neighbors play out across the courtyard. When he suspects his neighbor of murdering his nagging wife, he enlists his socialite girlfriend (Grace Kelly) to help investigate the suspicious chain of events, leading to one of the most memorable and gripping endings in all of film history. Honored in AFI\'s 100 Years…100 Movies for excellence in film, Rear Window has also been hailed as "one of Alfred Hitchcock\'s most stylish thrillers" (Leonard Maltin\'s Classic Movie Guide).', 'Bonus Content:', 'Rear Window Ethics: An Original Documentary', 'Rear Window Ethics: An Original Documentary', 'A Conversation with Screenwriter John Michael Hayes', 'A Conversation with Screenwriter John Michael Hayes', 'Production Photographs', 'Production Photographs', 'Production Notes', 'Production Notes', 'Re-Release Trailer Narrated by James Stewart', 'Re-Release Trailer Narrated by James Stewart', 'Theatrical Trailer', 'Theatrical Trailer', ']]>'] Average Rating: 4.8 Product Details: {'Genre': 'Rent movie, Mystery movie, Alfred Hitchcock movie, DVD movie, Blu-ray movie, Oscar movie, Movie night, Drama, Best Director movie, Academy Award movie, 4K movie, Thriller movie, Mystery & Suspense/Thrillers, Buy movie, Suspense movie, Digital movie, Drama movie, Jimmy Stewart movie, Mystery & SuspenseRent movie, Mystery movie, Alfred Hitchcock movie, DVD movie, Blu-ray movie, Oscar movie, Movie night, Drama, Best Director movie, Academy Award movie, 4K movie, Thriller movie, Mystery & Suspense/Thrillers, Buy movie, Suspense movie, Digital movie, Drama movie, J… See more', 'Format': 'Multiple Formats, Color, Dubbed, NTSC, Subtitled, Widescreen', 'Contributor': 'Grace Kelly, Thelma Ritter, Alfred Hitchcock, Robert Burks, John Michael Hayes, Wendell Corey, Loren L. Adams', 'Gabriel Macht', 'Genevieve Sparling', 'Ethan Drogin', 'Jon Cowan', 'Anton Cropper', 'Lilla Zuckerman', 'Nora Zuckerman', 'Gavin Barclay', 'Kevin Bray', 'Silver Tree', 'Desmond Paes', 'Chris Downey', 'Ryan Kennedy', 'Paul Redford', 'Sean Jablonski', 'Steve Wakefield', 'Mark Winemaker', 'Chevy Chen', 'Igor Srubshchik', 'Kyle Long', 'Natalie Urquhart', 'Jonathan Starch'], 'Starring': ['Gabriel Macht', 'Patrick J. Adams', 'Rick Hoffman'], 'Studio': ['USA']} Review Text: I chose my tv viewing carefully and I thought this show was clever and entertaining through season 1. My only complaint would be there was too much unnecessary language but was willing to lower my standards for some entertainment that did not focus on the sexual relationships of the characters. What planet do these people live in that in a professional setting they swear in every sentence. Considering that they portray educated people, surely they use more articulate language to express their feelings.

Season 2 however was just too much. Too much drama, too much personal angst and definitely too visually inappropriate in the last episode. I never want to watch other people have sex and if this is the direction the show continues to take, this is the end of me watching this series. Review Title: Sad at the turn of events Rating: 2.0 -------------------------------------------------- === Purchase Information === Review Date: 2013/07/30 Average Rating: 4.8 Product Details: {'Audio languages': ['English'], 'Subtitles': ['English [CC]'], 'Directors': ['Graeme Harper', 'Euros Lyn', 'Jamie Magnus Stone', 'Douglas Mackinnon', 'Rachel Talalay', 'James Strong', 'Charlie Palmer', 'James Hawes', 'Joe Ahearne', 'Toby Haynes'], 'Starring': ['Christopher Eccleston', 'Billie Piper'], 'Studio': ['BBC America']} Review Text: I tend to like shows that are a little on the odd side and with characters that are unusual so this show fit the bill. I'm into season 3 and still enjoy suspending reality for a while and toodling across the universe with the good Doctor. Washing ashore in New York Harbor, Fievel braves the perils and wonders of a strange new world in a thrilling quest to find his family. raw_response:
SUMMARY:  
The individual exhibits a clear preference for classic and engaging cinematic experiences, particularly enjoying romantic comedies, dramas, and animated family films. High ratings indicate a strong appreciation for quality storytelling, often focusing on character-driven narratives and suspenseful plots, with a notable favor for iconic actors and directors. The emphasis on entertaining yet wholesome content suggests they value films that are family-friendly and pleasant, avoiding gory or excessively violent genres, as identified in their negative feedback on inappropriate language and themes.

Price sensitivity appears low, as they prioritize content quality over cost, often opting for box sets and classic films. They also display a trend toward mixed-format purchases, suggesting they enjoy diversity in their viewing options. In addition, their engagement with lighter and quirky narratives highlights a desire for entertainment that provides an escape from reality, reflected in their selection of films and TV shows.

Overall, they prefer well-produced, enriching, and nostalgic viewing experiences that evoke a sense of joy, while being cautious about inappropriate content. Their feedback indicates a willingness to adjust viewing standards for compelling storylines, although they draw the line at excessive vulgarity or explicitness.
